summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Board of Adjustment (Panel C) of the City of Dallas will convene on February 22, 2024, for a briefing at 10:30 A.M. followed by a public hearing at 1:00 P.M. The meeting will take place at Dallas City Hall, Room 6ES, with an option for videoconference participation. The purpose of the meeting is to address various zoning cases and adjustments requested by residents.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes a staff presentation, a public hearing for testimony, and the approval of previous meeting minutes. The Board will review uncontested items, holdover cases, and individual cases requiring decisions.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include requests for variances and special exceptions related to fence height, front-yard setbacks, and single-family use regulations. Specific cases to be discussed include applications from Ludovic Gombos for a fence height exception, Jokabet Anaya for a front-yard setback variance, and several other individual requests concerning property regulations.

**Action Items**:  
The Board is seeking approval for the minutes from the December 11, 2023 meeting and will deliberate on the listed zoning cases. Decisions will be made regarding the applications for variances and exceptions, which may impact local zoning regulations and property use. Public testimony will be taken into account before final decisions are rendered.
